snippet: While higher salaries can be reached relatively early in some districts, in others it can take more than three decades to get there, the National Council on Teacher Quality says.
abstract: Report by National Council on Teacher Quality, nonprofit group that advocates tougher teacher standards, asserts that over course of their careers, teachers in certain cities earn far less than those elsewhere and hit their pay scale maximum far later, making it hard for them to live a basic middle-class life.
lead_paragraph: While higher salaries can be reached relatively early in some districts, in others it can take more than three decades to get there, the National Council on Teacher Quality says.

headline.main: Middle-Class Pay Elusive for Teachers, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Middle-Class Pay Elusive for Teachers, Report Says
